attributes.action: MAKE PET OWNERS PAY FOR THE DAMAGE THEIR CATS & DOGS ARE DOING TO THE ENVIRONMENT
attributes.additional_details: ECOLOGICAL IMPACT... There have been many recent studies about the carbon footprint of one pet being equally as damaging to the environment as a motor vehicle with conclusions being that pet owners should pay considerably for this consequence. This would certainly help reduce the UK’s national debt crisis. There are some 13 million UK households with pets. If they each payed £200 annual pet fee (similar to the cost of an average vehicle road licence fee) would bring £2600 million into the treasury every year, hypothetically.
